H0.text: Oil is the renewable energy source used to make electricity that is thought to be always available.

H1.text: Coal is the renewable energy source used to make electricity that is thought to be always available.

H2.text: Wind is the renewable energy source used to make electricity that is thought to be always available.

H3.text: Nuclear is the renewable energy source used to make electricity that is thought to be always available.

A4.text: Wind power is mostly used to generate electricity.

A5.text: Wind is intermittent and the non-dispatchable nature of wind energy production can raise costs for regulation, incremental operating reserve, and could require an increase in the already existing energy demand management, load shedding, storage solutions, or system interconnection with HVDC cables.
